Name: The Silver Trumpet of Tutankhamun
Description: This silver trumpet with its golden mouthpiece was found with a decorated wooden core inside, probably to protect the thin metal from distortion, or to help in cleaning inside its tube with a piece of cloth. The decoration on the bell shows incised scenes of the gods Amun-Re and Re-Horakhty before Ptah. From experiments, the sound produced was described as "raucous and powerful" and it is likely that the trumpet signal code was a rhythmic one on a single pitch.
